item.title: Report E-2024080291
item.description:
Report E-2024080291

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that an unknown amount of UN1490 Cairox Potassium Permanganate Free-Flowing Grade from 1-55 gal DM due to a forklift/skid puncture. The release impacted 541-3037 trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2024080281
item.description:
Report E-2024080281

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) pounds of material was released due to a forklift damaging one(1) super sack. Clean Harbors personnel transferred the remaining material into a new super sack and then swept up the released material. The damaged super sack and recovered material were placed into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

item.title: Report E-2024080277
item.description:
Report E-2024080277

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-15T15:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-ounce of Gaze N Seal Green Concrete & Masonry Lacquer was released from a 5-gallon metal pail. The release impacted the wrapping inside trailer #3159451. Product had dried so no absorbents were used. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024080511
item.description:
Report X-2024080511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024080511 The package was damaged by the contents venting powder causing damage to the box. The item inside is a undeclared hazmat that was not processed properly. 2. X-2024080536 The package was damaged by the contents venting causing discoloration and tearing of the box. 3. X-2024080538 The package was found torn and upon inspection the package was a hazmat item. The venting allowed powder to seep out damaging the packaging. 4. X-2024080539 The package was damaged by the contents venting and allowing powder of the item to discolor and tear the package box. 5. X-2024080540 The package was torn and discolored when the contents vented. The items were a oxidizing item.

  • Description: RESPONDER SAW THAT ONE OF THE GALLONS WAS EMPTIED OUT AND WAS SPREAD OUT ALL OVER THE AREA. A PH TEST AND SOME INSIGHT FROM THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET HELPED RESPONDER CLEAN UP THE SPILL. AS SOON AS THE CLEAN UP WAS FINISHED, RESPONDER IMMEDIATELY HEADED BACK TO THE CAGE TO BEGIN WORKING ON THE HAZARD.

item.title: Report X-2024080587
item.description:
Report X-2024080587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: VICTORVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations.This was a 3 piece shipment with one declared dg package and two that were non hazardous. The two boxes in question were suspected to be DG. One contained machiner parts and the other was Concealed DG inside a brown fiberboard box. The cylinder inside was marked as UN 1057 with 1090 psig; 7167kPa. There was no release and the shipment is being held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024072493
item.description:
Report X-2024072493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was dropped down a chute and caused package to go sideways and cap to come loose and leak out. QA-admin discovered package leaking and placed the leaky package inside a hazmat bag with absorbent. QA-admin then cleaned up spill with absorbent and out the cleanup absorbent inside the hazmat bag was well. Bag was then placed inside and placed inside a hazmat tote to the Hazmat Processing cage for further processing. Hazmat Package is missing OP-900 and Hazmat Certificate paperwork. So, cannot approve for HAP.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/30/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 154002 at the station location in Temecula, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jug packaged in a FedEx padded pack. The commidity was discovered leaking from the closure, resulting in spillage that compromised the outer labeling. Based off the product name, Dangerous Goods Administration located an online safety data sheet, idnetifying the commodity as UN 3082 Environmentally hazardous substance, n.o.s.; however, the shipment was not properly packaged in strong rigid outer packaging, which voided the use of Special Provision A197. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024080127
item.description:
Report E-2024080127

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that "FORMULA 6410" UN1816 was released from a 5-gallon plastic jug due to a puncture. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released affecting a 12' x 4' area trailer floor and a 30’ x 3’ area beneath the trailer. The contractor collected and containerized the FORMULA 6410 and all clean-up debris into one (1) 30-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
